member.name: T:OpenCL.Abstract.Abstract
member.summary: Regulates the rules of working of the whole AbstractOpenCL environment.

member.name: F:OpenCL.Abstract.Abstract.diagnostics
member.summary: Stores the initial value of Diagnostics property.

member.name: F:OpenCL.Abstract.Abstract.traceErrors
member.summary: Stores the initial value of TraceErrors property.

member.name: F:OpenCL.Abstract.Abstract.throwOnErrors
member.summary: Stores the initial value of ThrowOnErrors property.

member.name: M:OpenCL.Abstract.Abstract.Trace(System.String)
member.summary: Writes the input to System.Diagnostics.Trace

member.name: M:OpenCL.Abstract.Abstract.Trace(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Writes the input to System.Diagnostics.Trace

member.name: M:OpenCL.Abstract.Abstract.TraceLine(System.String)
member.summary: Writes the input to System.Diagnostics.Trace

member.name: M:OpenCL.Abstract.Abstract.TraceLine(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Writes the input to System.Diagnostics.Trace

member.name: M:OpenCL.Abstract.Abstract.Diagnose(OpenCL.Abstract.ErrorCode)
member.summary: Returns a string (if available) that explains the given error code.

member.name: M:OpenCL.Abstract.Abstract.LogIfError(OpenCL.Abstract.ErrorCode)
member.summary: Writes an entry to log if an error was detected. Returns true if it was detected.
member.param: the code of error
member.returns: true if error code was not equal to ErrorCode.Success

member.name: P:OpenCL.Abstract.Abstract.Diagnostics
member.summary: If true, all AbstracOpenCL methods will print self-diagnostic information using System.Diagnostics.Trace - this makes them much slower, but it is useful to determine what is in fact happening.

member.name: P:OpenCL.Abstract.Abstract.TraceErrors
member.summary: If true, all AbstracOpenCL methods will print information using System.Diagnostics.Trace in case there is any error. Error situation is defined as such when the ErrorCode returned by the underlying call to OpenCL API is different than CL_SUCCESS. This is very useful track down source of error.

member.name: P:OpenCL.Abstract.Abstract.ThrowOnErrors
member.summary: If true, all AbstracOpenCL methods will throw exception in case there is any error. If false, none will throw. If null, the behaviour implemented by default will occur, i.e. some will throw and some will not.

member.name: T:OpenCL.Abstract.Buffer`1
member.summary: Buffer is a general-purpose MemoryObject.

member.name: T:OpenCL.Abstract.MemoryObject`1
member.summary: Abstract parent of Buffer and Image classes
member.typeparam: type of the entries contained in the memory

member.name: M:OpenCL.Abstract.MemoryObject`1.Dispose
member.summary: Sets field values to null, meant to be overriden by non-abstract subclasses.

member.name: M:OpenCL.Abstract.MemoryObject`1.AddWritingResult(OpenCL.Abstract.ActionResult)
member.summary: This method should be executed only in case of diagnostic run, i.e. when Abstract.Diagnostics is true.
member.param: result that is added to the list of writing results

member.name: M:OpenCL.Abstract.MemoryObject`1.AddReadingResult(OpenCL.Abstract.ActionResult)
member.summary: This method should be executed only in case of diagnostic run, i.e. when Abstract.Diagnostics is true.
member.param: result that is added to the list of reading results

member.name: M:OpenCL.Abstract.MemoryObject`1.Write
member.summary: Copies the whole default backing collection into the buffer using default command queue.

member.name: M:OpenCL.Abstract.MemoryObject`1.Write(OpenCL.Abstract.CommandQueue,System.Boolean,`0[],System.UInt32,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Writes given source collection to the given subset of the buffer.
member.param: command queue on which the writing will be performed
if true, the method blocks until writing has ended
source array
starting index of buffer to be overwritten
number of buffer entries to be overwritten
member.returns: true if writing procedure was successfully invoked

member.name: M:OpenCL.Abstract.MemoryObject`1.Read
member.summary: Reads the whole buffer using default command queue and stores it in the default backing collection.

member.name: M:OpenCL.Abstract.MemoryObject`1.Read(System.UInt32,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Reads a selected part of the buffer using default command queue and stores it at the beginning of the default backing collection.

member.name: M:OpenCL.Abstract.MemoryObject`1.Copy(OpenCL.Abstract.MemoryObject{`0})
member.summary: Enqueues copying of all contents of this MemoryObject to another MemoryObject.
member.param: target memory
member.returns: true if the copy operation was successfully enqueued

member.name: P:OpenCL.Abstract.MemoryObject`1.DefaultQueue
member.summary: Command queue, on which the memory object enqueues its actions by default.

member.name: P:OpenCL.Abstract.MemoryObject`1.Length
member.summary: Length of the backing collection, and also the memory object itself.

member.name: P:OpenCL.Abstract.MemoryObject`1.LengthSigned
member.summary: Gets length of this memory object as a signed integer.

member.summary: Disposes the underlying OpenCL memory handle.

member.summary: Initializes all devices from all platforms.

member.summary: Initializes at most the given number of devices of any type from all available platforms.

member.returns: array of devices that has length and contents meeting the criteria

member.summary: Initializes at most the given number of devices of given type from all available platforms.

member.returns: array of devices that has length and contents meeting the criteria
